data:
High Risk Patients (greater than 5% risk):
- Burkitts Leukemia/Lymphoma
- ALL (White Blood Cells greater than 100 or less than 100 and Lactate Dehydrogenase greater than or equal to 2 times upper limit of normal)
- Stage III/IV B-Cell or T-Cell lymphoblastic (LDH greater than or equal to 2 times upper limit of normal)
- AML (White Blood Cells greater than 100)
- Any patient with intermediate risk disease who has renal dysfunction, elevated uric acid, hyperkalemia or hyperphosphatemia

Intermediate Risk Patients (1 to 5% risk):
- ALL (White Blood Cells less than 100 and Lactate Dehydrogenase less than 2 times upper limit of normal)
- AML (White Blood Cells 25 to 100 or  less than 25 and Lactate Dehydrogenase greater than or equal to 2 times upper limit of normal)
- Stage III/IV anaplastic large cell lymphoma, stage III/IV diffuse large B-cell or stage I/II B-cell and T-cell lymphblastic lymphomas with LDH less than 2 times upper limit of normal
- Bulky solid tumours sensitive to chemotherapy (e.g. Neuroblastoma)

Low Risk Patients (Less than 1% risk):
- AML (White Blood Cells less than 25 and Lactate Dehydrogenase less than 2 times upper limit of normal)
- All other lymphomas (e.g. Hodgkin)
- Most solid tumours
q1h, monitor heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate and temperature
q2h, monitor heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate and temperature
q4h, monitor heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate and temperature
Monitor for adequate urine output of 3 mL/kg/h or 4 to 6 mL/kg/h for children less than 10 kg
Do not order potassium replacement. It is contraindicated for acute tumour lysis syndrome
Consider 1 to 2 times maintenance fluid for starting rate
If allopurinol total daily dose exceeds 300 mg, please select BID dosing
5 mg/kg,  PO, BID, drug form: tab
5 mg/kg,  PO, BID, drug form: oral liq
10 mg/kg, PO, qdaily, drug form:oral liq
0.15 mg/kg,  IV, once, drug form: inj
Consider cardiorespiratory monitoring and Electrocardiogram 12 Lead
50 mg/kg, IV, q5min, PRN (see other comment), order duration: 2 doses or times, administer over: 10 min, drug form; inj
5 puff, inhalation, once, drug form: inhaler
10 puff, inhalation, once, drug form: inhaler
0.1 unit/kg/dose, IV, once, drug form: inj
For additional or ongoing hyperkalemia management, select PED Hyperkalemia Management (Module)
If hyperphosphatemia, consider increasing IV fluid rate, Electrocardiogram 12-Lead and cardiorespiratory monitoring
330 mg/m2, PO, TID, drug form: oral liq
330 mg/m2, PO, TID, drug form: tab
Notify Lab if patient is receiving rasburicase and ensure bloodwork is sent in prechilled tube and immediately placed on ice
Send first set of tumor lysis bloodwork 4 hours after chemotherapy initiated

Notify provider if Potassium Level greater than 5 mmoL/L, Calcium Level less than 1.75 mmoL/L or Phosphate Level is greater than 2.1 mmoL/L
Consider consultation with Nephrology and PICU
